message_1: How many ways can you choose a committee of 3 people from a group of 7 individuals?
message_2:
To choose a committee of 3 people from a group of 7 individuals, we can use the combination formula, which is:

C(n, k) = n! / (k!(n-k)!)

where n is the total number of individuals (7 in this case) and k is the number of people to choose (3 in this case).

C(7, 3) = 7! / (3!(7-3)!)

C(7, 3) = 7! / (3!4!)

C(7, 3) = (7*6*5*4*3*2*1) / ((3*2*1)*(4*3*2*1))

C(7, 3) = (7*6*5) / (3*2*1)

C(7, 3) = 210 / 6

C(7, 3) = 35

So there are 35 ways to choose a committee of 3 people from a group of 7 individuals.
